data.title: Class: DBM (Ruby 2.6.4)
data.text:
Open a dbm database with the specified name, which can include a directory path. Any file extensions needed will be supplied automatically by the dbm library. For example, Berkeley DB appends â.dbâ, and GNU gdbm uses two physical files with extensions â.dirâ and â.pagâ.

The mode should be an integer, as for Unix chmod.

Flags should be one of READER, WRITER, WRCREAT or NEWDB.
